data.name: XSimpleCanvas
desc: Provides the basic graphical output operations for a canvas.
This interface is a simplified version of the XCanvas interface. It holds explicit state, i.e. the pen and fill color, the current transformation, clip and font are persistently remembered.

In contrast to the XCanvas interface, XSimpleCanvas does not distinguish between stroke and fill operations; instead, switching between stroke and fill (or taking both) works by setting appropriate pen and fill colors.

methods.name: drawBitmap
desc: Draws the bitmap on the canvas.

methods.name: drawLine
desc: Draws a line on the canvas.

methods.name: drawPixel
desc: Sets a single pixel on the canvas.

methods.name: drawPolyPolygon
desc: Draws a poly-polygon on the canvas.

methods.name: drawRect
desc: Draws a rectangle on the canvas.

methods.name: drawText
desc: Draws text on the canvas.

methods.name: getCanvas
desc: Query the underlying XCanvas.

methods.name: getCurrentClipRect
desc: Retrieve current clip rect.

methods.name: getCurrentFillColor
desc: Retrieve color currently used for fills.

methods.name: getCurrentFont
desc: Retrieve currently selected font.

methods.name: getCurrentPenColor
desc: Retrieve color currently used for lines.

methods.name: getCurrentRenderState
desc: Retrieve render state.

methods.name: getCurrentTransformation
desc: Retrieve current transformation matrix.

methods.name: getCurrentViewState
desc: Retrieve view state.

methods.name: getDevice
desc: Request the associated graphic device for this canvas.

A graphic device provides methods specific to the underlying output device capabilities, which are common for all canvases rendering to such a device. This includes device resolution, color space, or bitmap formats.

methods.name: getFontMetrics
desc: Request the font metrics of the current font.

methods.name: selectFont
desc: Select a font.
This method selects the specified font (or a close substitute) as the current font for text output.

methods.name: setFillColor
desc: Sets the fill color.
To disable filling, simply set this color to something with zero alpha (i.e. fully transparent).

methods.name: setPenColor
desc: Sets the color used by line and text operations.
To disable stroking, simply set this color to something with zero alpha (i.e. fully transparent).

methods.name: setRectClip
desc: Sets the clip to the specified rectangle.

methods.name: setTransformation
desc: Set the current transform matrix.
